intro: Trigonotis zhuokejiensis, commonly known as the Zhuokeji spiderflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
